#summary One-sentence summary of this page.

= Introduction =

OPath is an extension of [XPath] language but for object graph. I will explain basic terminology here.


= Details =

Each OPath expression consists of one or more step separated by '/' or '//'.

|| *Construct* || *Description* ||
|| '/' || Step separator. A/B means child variable B of variable A||
|| '//' || Multilevel step separator. A//B means any descendent variable B of A at all levels, this will force interpreter to traverse entire object graph.||
|| '*' || Selects all children. A/* will select all children variables of variable A.
